quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Marlena and Days
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, marlenas, vocals. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The theme song from Get a Life was a hit song from what musical group?
On the show Casmere Mafia, Mia was attracted to Eric and Zoes sexy manny? What was his name?
Of Marlenas men, who is the first one that has been portrayed by more than one actor?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Roman Brady

questions.question: When Marlena first met Roman on days of Our Lives, she fell in love with him at first sight.
Which of these men was Marlenas first love on the popular TV show Days of Our Lives?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Paul Whitman

questions.question: Which cast member sings lead vocals on the theme song in season five of HBOs The Wire?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Steve Earle

questions.question: What character from the TV show Cashmere Mafia is a magazine publisher?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mia Mason

questions.question: Which list depicts the targets for each season of HBOs The Wire in order?

options.text: Stringer Bell, Marlo Stansfield, The Greek, Avon Barksdale
Avon Barksdale, The Greek, Clayton Clay Davis, Ervin H. Burrell
Avon Barksdale, Frank Sobotka, Stringer Bell, Marlo Stansfield
Avon Barksdale, Stringer Bell, Frank Sobotka, Marlo Stansfield

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Avon Barksdale, Frank Sobotka, Stringer Bell, Marlo Stansfield

questions.question: On the TV show Days of Our Lives, John, Roman, Paul and Don have all professed undying love for Marlena.
Mia Mason, one of the protagonists on the Cashmere Mafia show, was engaged to this man for a week.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jack Cutling

questions.question: One of Marlenas men couldnt tell the difference between Marlena and her twin sister, Samantha, and ended up sleeping with Sam.
What is Juliet Drapers ex-husbands name in the TV series Cashmere Mafia?
Which one of these men did Marlena cheat on on Days of Our Lives?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Roman Brady

questions.question: Caitlin Dowd, one of the main characters on Cashmere Mafia, is a confused lesbian/bisexual.
When TV characters Don Craig and Marlena Evans first met, she refused to go out with him because she thought he was in love with another woman.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lightspeed Rescue and Wild Force

There are two Red Rangers in Power Rangers: Time Force.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Red, Blue, Green, Pink, Yellow

questions.question: Which of these isnt a Time Force villain?
Name the Special Ranger in Power Rangers: Time Force.
One of the remnants of this states former status as a possession of France is the fact that it was named after a French king.
What city is the show Cashmere Mafia set in?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New York

questions.question: No state has as many different species of mammals as this one. The average square mile of land contains 1.4 elk, 1.4 pronghorn antelope, and 3.3 deer.
Complete these lyrics from the theme song of Power Rangers: Time Force:
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fire and Thunder

questions.question: What is Caitlins girlfriends name on Cashmere Mafia?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Alicia Lawson

questions.question: What Zord in Power Rangers: Time Force is operated through voice activation by the Quantum Ranger and is incapable of combining with other Zords?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Quantasaurus-Rex

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: State and Capital

questions.question: What is the state capital of Washington?
What is the state capital of Nevada?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Carson City

questions.question: This country shares common boundaries with every South American country except Chile and Ecuador.
What is the state capital of Alaska?
What is the state capital of Arizona?
During World War II, this country was able to successfully defend its freedom and resist invasions by the Soviet Union - despite some loss of territory. It joined the European Union in 1995.
What is the state capital of California?
The largest lake in this state is Lake Okeechobee. The state is also home to one of the two naturally round lakes in the world.
What is the state capital of Utah?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Salt Lake city

questions.question: One of the following pairs (state - its capital) is wrong.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: North Dakota - Fargo

questions.question: What is the state capital of Idaho?
What is the state capital of Oregon?
The 3rd Monday in April is Patriots Day - a legal holiday in this state.
Arizona became the 48th state on February 14, 1912.
Francis Drake was 66 years old at his inauguration and the oldest governor of this state.

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: City and Country
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, ties, sinai. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This city situated south of China is made up of 230 islands, Lantau Island being the largest.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hong Kong

questions.question: The cable cars of this city are the only mobile National Monument.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: San Francisco

questions.question: Its three-year-old Socialist government was overthrown in 1973 by a dictatorial military regime led by Augusto Pinochet.
The first American capital.  It has a nick name coined by musicians - it means  to play the big time.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New York

questions.question: This country dominates the Aegian Sea and possesses an archipelago of about 2,000 islands.
This country is home to the northernmost capital in mainland Europe?
This city is the only one located on two continents.
When broken down into kanji, the name of this capital city means east and capital.
This country controls the Sinai Peninsula.  Following the completion of the Suez Canal in 1869, it became an important world transportation hub.
After gaining its independence in 1991, it has retained closer political and economic ties to Russia than any of the other former Soviet republics.
In the devilish year of  1666 a great fire occured in this European capital city. Half of it burned down.
It was once the center of power for an empire.  Occupied by the allies in 1945, a state treaty ended its occupation in 1955 and recognized its independence.
The Seine river divides this city into the Rive Droite (French for Right Bank) north of the river and the Rive Gauche (French for Left Bank) south of the river.
It is the sixth largest country and home of The Doctor breeze.
This countrys national holidays include:

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: States and City
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, carolina, fuji. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The name of mount Kilimanjaro comes from Swahili and means the mountain that glitters.
Sullivan street (in Sullivan County) serves as the state line, running east and west, effectively bi-locating this town in two states.  Name the city and the two states.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bristol, Tennessee, Virginia

questions.question: Mount Fuji is a nearly perfectly shaped volcano.  It has been worshipped as a sacred mountain.
The border between Georgia and Mississippi is also a time zone boundary.
Is the state of North Carolina south of the Mason - Dixon line?
Which of these U.S. states is not a Four Corners state?
The town of San Ysidro is located in what state, near what border?

options.text: California, near the border with Mexico.
Washington, near the border with Oregon
California,  near the border with Arizona
Iowa, near the border with Missouri

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: California, near the border with Mexico.

questions.question: Through thousands of years in existence, Niagara Falls has been eroding at a rate of 4 feet (1.5 meters) per year.
Mount Everest was formed some 50 million years ago. It rises a few meters each year because of geological forces. On the border between which two countries is this mount situated?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: China and Nepal

questions.question: Although Angel Falls bear the notion of something angelic, the phenomenon is named after Jimmy Angel, a barnstorming pilot from Missouri, who has become a modern legend.
This Peruvian city is stuck between the desert and the sea. It is also known as The City of the Kings.
This city is famous for its water-channel traffic. It has been designated a World Heritage Site.
From forest to desert, the Grand Canyon has the most extreme nature climate.
The Appalachian Trail divides two states as it makes its trek through Great Smoky Mountains National Park. Name the states it divides.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: North Carolina and Tennessee.

questions.question: One of this citys most prominent landmarks is the Brandenburger Tor (Brandenburg Gate).  It once marked the boundary between East and West Germany.

quizzes.title: History Quiz: State and Us
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, people, colonies. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This volcano, featured in a short 1933 Academy Award-winning movie, is located near the Indonesian island of Rakata, in the Sunda Strait.
This Bluegrass State hosts a famous horserace in Louisville, and is the birthplace of President Abraham Lincoln.
The scientific name for the Northern Lights phenomenon is Aurora Borealis. They are often mistaken for UFOs.  Where do they happen?

options.text: In the southern part of our planet
In the northern part of our planet

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: In the northern part of our planet

questions.question: The Great Barrier Reef consists of many colonies of corals. That is why it is sometimes referred to as the largest living animal in the world.
Krakatoa volcano caused the most violent volcanic eruption recorded in worlds history.  In 1883, it destroyed 75 % of the territory of its island.
This US state, known as the Equality State, is home of Devils Tower, featured in the movie Close Encounters of the Third Kind.
Nicknamed the Green Mountain State, this eastern US state was admitted to the Union on March 4, 1791.
Home on the Range is the state song of this US mid-western state, known as The Sunflower State.
The Beehive State requested admission to the Union in 1849 under the name Deseret.  After polygamous marriage practices were discontinued, it was finally admitted in 1896, under what name?
Nicknamed the Ocean State, it is the smallest US state.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rhode Island

questions.question: Local Batonga people had named Victoria Falls Mosi-Oa-Tunya, which stands for the smoke that thunders.
This US state, nicknamed The Sunshine State, is famous with its beaches and theme parks.
Nicknamed The Buckeye State, it is the birthplace many former US presidents, including Ulysses S. Grant.
Nicknamed the Treasure State, this western US state is fourth largest in area.
Nicknamed the Grand Canyon State, it entered the Union on Feb 14, 1912.
